chargeHist.descr: Fraud Against Financial Institution (Value Exceeds $10,000 but does not Exceed $100,000)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Arthur Allen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: ***Based on a Restitution Hearing held October 23, 2014 the court orders restitution in the amount of $9482.75.*** Restitution to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $300 starting December 1, 2014. In the event that the Defendant is revoked or discharged from probation with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the Court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement action will be used to collect the debt.

Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

No contact with K. Weldon and/or K. Karem directly or indirectly. No phone calls, e-mails, text messages, written communications or by third party.  The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety and may not be present upon the premises of any bars.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: The defendant is entitled to Huber Privileges. No Good Time Credit. Sentence to commence forthwith.

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 10:15 a.m. Defendant Brian Arthur Allen in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Defendant Brian Arthur Allen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The parties have reached an agreement. Resolution recited by DA Blader.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Cts 2 & 3 - DRI.  Statement by the victim who appears telephonically. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Mann - DE is waiving his right to a PSI. No statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 30 mos probation - Conditions: 90 days WCJ - Huber, No GT, 37 days CFTS, Restitution in the amount of $9,482.75 to be repaid in monthly increments of no less than $300 starting 12-01-2014, DE may petition the court for a restitution hearing within 30 days of today's date, NC w/ K. Weldon and/or K. Karem, maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DNA sample and surcharge, costs w/ 60 DTP or PP. Appeal rights given.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:55 p.m. Defendant Brian Arthur Allen in court with attorney Jeffrey Allen Mann.  Defendant Brian Arthur Allen in custody.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived. Defendant is requesting a preliminary hearing. Motion by Atty Mann for bond modification to allow the defendant to retrieve funds to post bond. Statement by a representative of the bank. Statement by DA Blader regarding modification of bond. The court will allow the bank to withdraw only the funds that have been deposited by the defendant's employer that will be forwarded to the defendant at the jail. The court entertains waiver of the time limits for the preliminary hearing. The court accepts voluntary waiver of the time limits. Preliminary hearing Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Return of Search Warrant, Search Warrant, Application for Search Warrant, Itemization of Seized Property
Initial appearance on July 31, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.  Defendant is prohibited from going on the premises of any bars.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:29 PM: Defendant Brian Arthur Allen in court, appearing via video.  Steven Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  In pending case he is represented by Atty Haase.  ADA argues as to $1000 cash bond.   Argument as to bond by Def - concern over paychecks being deposited at the bank and the no contact provisions.  Further argument by ADA as to bond conditions.  The Court:  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Some flight risk inherent.  Orders $1000 Cash Bond with same conditions as previous bond as to 14CM-74 and new no contact provisions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 31, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
